intro: Noccaea crantzii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Its small, bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Noccaea crantzii is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant.
